page.title: 01GENERAL SURVEY OF THE AREA
page.content: The block covers an area of country in south Herefordshire bordering Glouces- tershire.A lush agricultural region of dairy,grain and orchard with large tracts of softwood forest plantations. Linton village dating back to Norman times lies wholly within the block whilst Upton Bishop borders the N.W. Most of Gorsely is within this wooded and once gorse covered area and was for two centuries the haunt of ciminals.Those in Ross nick_named it "The Republic of the lawless" and Gorsley common became known as "Heathens Heath."The area was notorious for its unruly behaviour and often the Hereford to London stage coach was held up and plundered as it made its way through the village en route to Gloucester. By refering to the following entries you will see how different it has become.
